html: Additionally, no one should be making a woman’s healthcare decision except her and her doctor. In Congress, I will keep driving us towards equal rights and economic parity for women in our country. Thank you. (5/5)
text: Additionally, no one should be making a woman’s healthcare decision except her and her doctor. In Congress, I will keep driving us towards equal rights and economic parity for women in our country. Thank you. (5/5)

html: Women deserve equal pay for equal work. Period. Last year, I proudly co-sponsored the Paycheck Fairness Act to ensure that women receive equal pay for equal work. Congress must continue to take the necessary steps to ensure that women are getting the pay they deserve. (4/5)
text: Women deserve equal pay for equal work. Period. Last year, I proudly co-sponsored the Paycheck Fairness Act to ensure that women receive equal pay for equal work. Congress must continue to take the necessary steps to ensure that women are getting the pay they deserve. (4/5)

html: But we know that American women still face enormous obstacles to true equality. (3/5)
text: But we know that American women still face enormous obstacles to true equality. (3/5)

html: We live in a time where three women currently sit on the Supreme Court, women hold twenty percent of all congressional seats, and scores sit in America’s boardrooms. The sky should be the limit for all of our daughters. (2/5)
text: We live in a time where three women currently sit on the Supreme Court, women hold twenty percent of all congressional seats, and scores sit in America’s boardrooms. The sky should be the limit for all of our daughters.  (2/5)

html: Today we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay, commemorating the 98th anniversary of the adoption of the 19th Amendment, guaranteeing women the right to vote. I’d like to take this moment to recognize how far we’ve come as a nation and where we still need to go. (1/5)
